newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH 1997 BUDGET VOTES SEEN AFTER 1720 CET.
newsitem.headline: CZECH 1997 BUDGET VOTES SEEN AFTER 1720 CET.

text.p: The lower house of Czech parliament has taken a recess from debate on the final reading of the government's draft 1997 budget, and will reconvene at 1720 CET (1620 GMT).
After the session resumes, votes on 23 separate line-item amendments are expected followed by a final vote on the entire budget package.
The house has voted to suspend the rules and allow votes, if necessary, to be taken after the mandated cutoff of 1900 local time.
The government draft proposes equal revenue and expenditure of 549.1 billion crowns in 1997 up from the revised 1996 budget of 491 billion crowns.
The draft of the minority government was approved in its first reading in October after four opposition Social Democrat deputies broke party ranks to allow the package to move on.
There has been no indication that the four Social Democrat deputies have changed their position ahead of the final vote, and the budget is expected to be approved.
